result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin Markus Clayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders restitution in the stipulated amount of $2,000 payable to Crime Victim- joint and several with Kelsea Smith (15CF000648).

Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge. Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs. The Court ordered all financial obligations and restitution (PAID FIRST) to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program ONLY AFTER SERVING 1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT ON THIS SENTENCE.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT to time being served with credit for 9 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms or body armor.
Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

Participate in Cognitive behavioral therapy program.
Participate in Vocational rehabilitation training/schooling.
Participate in Parenting class.
The Court recommends that the defendant participate in Former's Anonymous Program (optional).
Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment. Absolute sobriety- submit to random urine screens.

charges.descr: Attempt Armed Robbery with Use of Force

Sentencing Hearing on Tuesday, November 3, 3015 at 8:30 AM in BR 6, SB Rm 423 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.
Original GUILTY PLEA Transcript (11 pages) commencing APRIL 21, 2015 received and filed.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Tyese K.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26212009 in court 2x on 4/20/15, 8/12/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Tyese K. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Calvin Markus Clayton not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Judge Brostrom agreed to take this case for sentencing as she heard the trial of the co-defendants and the testimony of this defendant. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 11/3/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 6.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Calvin Markus Clayton not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
ADA Hayes is in trial in Branch 6. Case rescheduled for SENTENCING on 8/18/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Calvin Markus Clayton not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was returned to Dodge Correctional yesterday.  Counsels are requesting that the sentencing be adjourned until after the co-actors trial which is set for August 10.  Defendant is to cooperate with the state.  Court will grant the adjournment to 8-14-2015 for sentencing.
  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15, 502 SB.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
PSI emailed to ADA Sara Lewis and Atty Rick Poulson.
Order To Produce Transport
The court will modify the no contact order as to Deborah C. and will allow the defendant to have contact as long as Deborah C. has no objection.

The defendant has entered into a Testimonial Cooperative Agreement with the state.  The state is amending the charges against the defendant.  To the amended charge:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 6-5-2015 at 8:15.  The court orders a PSI.

Defendant Calvin Markus Clayton in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Calvin Markus Clayton in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed by the state: Attempt Armed Robbery(use of force) PTAC, a class C felony
pursuant to 943.32(1)(a) and (2), 939.32 and 939.05

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Calvin Markus Clayton not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.
Case called.  State informs the court that the defendant had an interview with law enforcement last week and that a Cooperative Agreement has been tendered to defendant.  Atty Poulson is requesting additional time to meet with defendant and discuss state's offer.  
Case is adjourned to 4-21-2015 for trial or plea.
(defense)
(defense)

Defendant Calvin Markus Clayton in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Calvin Markus Clayton in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.  Case called.
The court has been informed by the state that the defendant has violated the no contact order as to witnesses in this case; state is requesting an adjournment of the trial to allow for further investigation.  The court will not adjourn trial. Case remains in trial posture.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Calvin Markus Clayton not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are requesting another final pretrial next week.  Case is set for 4-16-2015 at 8:15am  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Calvin Markus Clayton not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND was entered on 2-18-2015.
Case set for final pretrial on 4-6-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 4-20-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-25-2015.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Calvin Markus Clayton in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Calvin Markus Clayton in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kelsea Smith., Lamont M, Zahid Z., Jonathan P., Kiara C., Jasmine W., Deborah C., "MSW", Deborah W., Tyese T., Joel M. and victim, Eduardo V.'s family and mother of his child.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Calvin Markus Clayton in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Calvin Markus Clayton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
